title: 4 Pieces of Advice for My 20-Year-Old Kid to Avoid Being Broke at 35
subtitle: Essential tips to establish a strong financial foundation for a successful future.
content:
4 Pieces of Advice for My 20-Year-Old Kid to Avoid Being Broke at 35

I'm Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. Now I make financial content for free so you don't have to pay for it.

1. Find a Mentor, Not Just a Job

You learn from people, not from paychecks. Seek out mentors who can guide you and provide valuable insights into their experiences.

2. Invest in Books, Not Degrees

$75 will buy you The Simple Path to Wealth, a book all about asset allocation and the psychology of money. It will teach you more about wealth than a quarter of a million dollar econ degree.

3. Learn to Market Yourself

No matter what you end up doing, learning how to market yourself is the number one skill you will ever develop, and it’s applicable to any goal you pursue.

4. Choose Your Friends Wisely

It’s true what they say: you wind up being the average of the five people with whom you spend the most time. Surround yourself with positive influences and ambitious individuals.

5. Start Investing Early

By investing just $3.47 a day into a Roth IRA, you can become a tax-free millionaire by the age of 65.

Conclusion

If any of this is helpful, sign up for my free weekly newsletter by clicking the link in my bio. Each week, I'll send you another money playbook that actually works.
